---
category: news
title: "Visual object recognition is facilitated by temporal community structure."
excerpt: "Humans and others primates are highly attuned to temporal consistencies and regularities in their sensory environment and learn to predict such statistical structure. Moreover, in several instances, the presence of temporal structure has been found to facilitate procedural learning and to improve task performance."
publishedDateTime: 2021-04-20T19:39:00Z
